title: Problem labeling in 2.2b5 and above releases
body:
Thanks for opening this issue, and thanks for using DeepLabCut (we hope you are enjoying it ;). Please fill out the template completely, including the full "traceback" and input code that you ran to hit this error. **Your Operating system and DeepLabCut version** Please complete the following information about your system: OS: Windows 10 DeepLabCut Version: 2.2b8, 2.2b7,b6, b5 Anaconda env used: python 3.6 I'm having issues labeling in multi-animal mode in version 2.2b7 and b8. It seems like the issue lies in wx and am wondering if its a compatibility issue between this latest version of DLC and wx? I attached the error message below. I've uninstalled and reinstalled wx python and the issue still stands
>>> import deeplabcut >>> >>> config_path = (r"C:\Users\NAPEadmin\Desktop\tr-project-2mouse-jj-agf-2020-10-08-20201015T230516Z-001\tr-project-2mouse-jj-agf-2020-10-08\config.yaml") >>> deeplabcut.label_frames(config_path) >>>

[Traceback (most recent call last): File "", line 1, in File "C:\Users\NAPEadmin\.conda\envs\jess_dlc_multi\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\generate_training_dataset\trainingsetmanipulation.py", line 427, in label_frames multiple_individuals_labeling_toolbox.show(config) File "C:\Users\NAPEadmin\.conda\envs\jess_dlc_multi\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\generate_training_dataset\multiple_individuals_labeling_toolbox.py", line 1344, in show frame = MainFrame(None, config).Show() File "C:\Users\NAPEadmin\.conda\envs\jess_dlc_multi\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\generate_training_dataset\multiple_individuals_labeling_toolbox.py", line 289, in __init__ widgetsizer.Add(self.quit, 1, wx.ALL | wx.ALIGN_RIGHT, 15) wx._core.wxAssertionError: C++ assertion "!(flags & wxALIGN_RIGHT)" failed at ..\..\src\common\sizer.cpp(2098) in wxBoxSizer::DoInsert(): Horizontal alignment flags are ignored in horizontal sizers]
